DOC.brief_summary: This multicenter , prospective study design demonstrate performance safety FiberNet Embolic Protection System use adjunctive device saphenous vein graft ( SVG ) intervention .
DOC.brief_title: The RETRIEVE Study : Use FiberNet® Embolic Protection System Saphenous Vein Grafts
DOC.detailed_description: The study involve 30 patient enrol use FiberNet device clinically indicate percutaneous intervention SVG follow 30 day post procedure . Patients enrol 10 Investigative Sites . The study prospective multi-center registry sequential enrollment qualify patient consent participate meet entrance criterion . The Lumen Biomedical , Inc. FiberNet® Embolic Protection System indicate use guide wire embolic protection system capture remove embolic material ( thrombus/debris ) produce perform percutaneous transluminal interventional procedure saphenous vein graft reference vessel diameter 1.75 mm 7.0 mm .
DOC.criteria: Candidate percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty ( PTCA ) , stenting emergent coronary artery bypass graft ( CABG ) . Myocardial ischemia evidence one following : Diagnosis stable unstable angina pectoris ECG change consistent ischemia Positive functional study Recent myocardial infarction Lesion ( ) locate within SVG ≥ 50 % < 100 % stenosed . Clinical Criteria : Myocardial infarction document total CKMB > 2 time upper limit normal within past 24 hour , currently experience acute myocardial infarction . Undergone cardiac surgery within past 60 day . A planned invasive surgical procedure within 30 day . The lesion ( ) SVG le 2 month postimplant . Left ventricular ejection fraction < 20 % . A stroke transient ischemic neurological attack ( TIA ) within past 2 month . Angiographic Criteria : The lesion ( ) arterial conduit . Lesion within 10 mm proximal anastomosis . More two native lesion [ addition SVG lesion ( ) ] need treat index procedure . More two SVGs need treat index procedure . Chronic total occlusion target lesion . The SVG lesion ( ) require treatment large device PTCA prior stent placement ( , limit , directional coronary atherectomy , excimer laser , rotational atherectomy , rheolytic thrombectomy brachytherapy ) .
